teacheasy.mediahandler.audio

Class Audio

  • java.lang.Object
    • teacheasy.mediahandler.audio.Audio

  • public class Audio
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates a single audio object on a page, including controls and media. Each audio object maintains its own state, and a list of the currently active audio objects is maintained by the audio handler.
    Version:
    1.3 15 April 2015
    Author:
    Alex Cash

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Audio.AudioSeekHandler
      EventHandler that listens to mouse inputs on the slider.
      class  Audio.controlsHandler
      EventHandler for presses of the controls button.
      class  Audio.muteHandler
      EventHandler for presses of the mute/unmute button.
      class  Audio.playHandler
      EventHandler for presses of the play/pause button.
      class  Audio.progressUpdater
      ChangeListener that listens to the current time value property of the mediaplayer.
      class  Audio.SeekListener
      ChangeListener to handle the user moving the progress bar manually (causing the audiohandler to seek through the media).
      class  Audio.VolumeListener
      ChangeListener to handle the user moving the volume slider.

    • Field Detail

      • buttonVisibilityLevel

        public int buttonVisibilityLevel
        Variable to be set to denote button visibility level. 0 = no visibility 1 = play/pause button only 2 = full visibility

      • collapsedControls

        public boolean collapsedControls
        Public boolean to indicate if controls are collapsed or not

      • xStartPos

        public float xStartPos

      • yStartPos

      • widthValue

        public float widthValue

    • Constructor Detail

      • Audio

        public Audio(javafx.scene.Group nGroup,
     float x,
     float y,
     float width,
     java.lang.String sourceFile,
     boolean autoPlay,
     boolean loop,
     boolean visibleControls,
     boolean playButtonOnly)
        Constructs the audio object.
        Parameters:
        nGroup - The group this audio object goes on.
        x - The x coordinate of the top left of the audio player relative to the group's origin.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left of the audio player relative to the group's origin.
        width - The width of the audio player in pixels.
        sourceFile - Absolute path of the audio track as a string. Can be a local file path or a web address beginning with 'http'
        autoPlay - If true the video plays immediately
        loop - If true the audio track loops to the beginning when it ends
        visibleControls - If true, there are visible buttons displayed. If this is not true, autoPlay is set to true
        playButtonOnly - If true, the only visible button is a play/pause button. If false and visibleControls is true, all control buttons are visible

      • audioSeek

        public void audioSeek(double percentSeek)
        Method to actually change the mediaplayers position through the media when the user seeks through the media.
        Parameters:
        percentSeek - the value to which the user requests the audio seek to.
